startup.notes: Application starts successfully. Pygame-ce 2.5.6 installed and working. Virtual environment created and dependencies installed.

features_tested.description: All game modules (game.py, config.py, main.py) import successfully
Pygame window created with specified dimensions (800x600)
Target objects are created with correct properties (radius=50, random position, proper color)
is_clicked() method correctly detects clicks inside and outside targets
Targets shrink over time (0.5 pixels per frame via shrink_rate)
Game class initializes with correct default values (score=0, misses=0, max_misses=3)
spawn_target() method correctly creates and adds targets to the game
Game configured to run at 60 FPS
ESC key and QUIT events properly handled for exiting the game

performance.notes: Game configured to run at 60 FPS. Difficulty increases based on score.

summary: The Reaction Reflex Test application passes all runtime tests. The application starts correctly using uv run, all Python modules import without errors, pygame-ce is properly installed (v2.5.6), and core game mechanics (Target class, Game class, click detection, shrinking mechanics, spawning) work as expected. The game window initializes properly, event handling is functional, and the game loop is configured for 60 FPS operation.
